english: to push; to shove; to promote; to infer

etymology.description: semantic 扌 (“hand”) + phonetic 隹 (OC *tjul) – push with the hand.
etymology.interpretation: A hand component signals an action done manually, while 隹 contributes the sound tuī and a sense of motion. Together they express applying force with the hand to move something forward or advance an idea.

examples.chinese: 他用力推门(他用力推門)。
公司在网上大力推广新产品(公司在網上大力推廣新產品)。
examples.pinyin: Gōngsī zài wǎngshàng dàlì tuīguǎng xīn chǎnpǐn.
examples.english: The company is vigorously promoting the new product online.

examples.chinese: 根据现有证据，我们可以推断他的动机(根據現有證據，我們可以推斷他的動機)。
examples.pinyin: Gēnjù xiànyǒu zhèngjù, wǒmen kěyǐ tuīduàn tā de dòngjī.
examples.english: Based on the existing evidence, we can infer his motive.
